title: What was the first smartphone? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on your definition of smartphone I suspect. The original treo (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treo_180) was released in 2002. As far as I remember however, the PDA part had no way to use the phone for a network connection, which to my mind makes it not a smartphone. The Wikipedia article (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smartphone) lists some very early devices back to 1992. Personally I'd say that the early Blackberry, Nokia and WindowsCE devices that had a PDA that could use the phone for data networking were the first real smartphones (circa 2002/2003).

Historically speaking it was IBM Simon, but that phone stands nowhere compared to today's smartphones. Considering my years of cellphone using experience I will say NOKIA 6600 was the first one of its kind revolutionary product. It came with a VGA camera, a video player, a music player and a memory card. It is one of the most successful mobiles till date and started a new trend in the mobile phone industry.
Symbian phone, the touchscreen Ericsson R380 Smartphone, was released in 2000, first smartphone
The world's first smartphone is “Simon” was created 15 years before the iPhone
It was called the Simon Personal Communicator, and it was created by IBM more than 15 years before Apple released the iPhone.

My mobile phones was quite low cost: Siemens M55 (4096 colors, 4 lines text, etc.)Motorola ROKR Z6 (2Mp camera, microSD up to 2 Gb)Motorola Defy+ (smartphone, 3,7″ screen, Android 2.3, 1700mAhJiayu G3 (smartphone, 8Mp back + 2Mp front camera, 1Gb RAM)Meizu M2 mini (smartphone, 5″ HD screen, 16 Gb ROM)Xiaomi Redmi 6 Pro (my current smartphone, I have written this post with it).
